Had an important conversation at @SeacoastSciCtr today where I met w/ biz & community leaders about effects of climate change. This is a severe threat to the region which is why I introduced legislation to prohibit the President from withdrawing from the Paris Climate Agreement. pic.twitter.com/gJhOqpSuGv

More than 47,000 bridges in the U.S. are in urgent need of repair. This is a threat to our public safety & economy. I introduced the SAFE Bridges Act to provide funding to repair & replace bridges in poor condition & create jobs in the process. Let’s pass this common-sense bill. pic.twitter.com/YFMo0UCCDE
Climate change is real, it’s here and it’s time for Congress to act if the President will not. #ActOnClimate

That’s why I introduced the International Climate Accountability Act – legislation prohibiting the Trump administration from using funds to withdraw from the Paris Climate Agreement.  https://www.shaheen.senate.gov/imo/media/doc/International%20Climate%20Accountability%20Act%202019.pdf …

The President’s decision to withdraw the United States from the historic Paris Climate Agreement, coupled with his administration’s relentless efforts to unravel protections that safeguard our air, water and land, relinquishes our nation’s global leadership on climate change.
We’re feeling the effects in New Hampshire, with rising temperatures that threaten seacoast flooding, our moose population, foliage season and the maple industry.

Warming temperatures, rising seas and extreme weather are taking a significant toll on our communities, with immediate threats to public safety and long-term implications for our wildlife, environment and the vitality of our economy.

The President & Members of Congress from both parties have spoken about the need to rehabilitate our aging & crumbling infrastructure – the SAFE Bridges Act is a chance to make good on that pledge while also creating jobs in the Granite State & across the country.

In the US, there are more than 47,000 bridges in urgent need of repair, which pose major public safety risks and hurt our economy. That’s why I’ve reintroduced legislation that would provide funding specifically dedicated to repairing and replacing bridges in poor condition.
